Body: Possible Duplicate:  How do I switch my Android device's SD card without causing problems?  I just moved to Android from iOS. My new droid is Sony Ericsson Xperia Neo V which came with a 2GB SD card. This card is almost full so I want to get a bigger and faster SD card. I have installed many apps on this SD card so I'm wondering how I can move all the content of the old card to the new one when I finally purchase it. How do I do this?
Title: How do I migrate from one SD card to another one?

history.Text: Ok I just moved to Android from iOS. My new droid is Sony Ericsson Xperia Neo V which came with a 2GB sd card. This card is almost full so I want to get a bigger and faster sd card. I have installed many apps on this sd card so I'm wondering how I can move all the content of the old card to the new one when I finally purchase it. How do I do this? Thanks in advance.
How do I migrate from one sd card to another one?

I just moved to Android from iOS. My new droid is Sony Ericsson Xperia Neo V which came with a 2GB SD card. This card is almost full so I want to get a bigger and faster SD card. I have installed many apps on this SD card so I'm wondering how I can move all the content of the old card to the new one when I finally purchase it. How do I do this?
How do I migrate from one SD card to another one?
